title: CookieJar::get_private_pending doesn't return pending private cookies

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Deviation from the specification or expected behavior

body:
**Description**

As far as I can tell, `CookieJar::get_private_pending` doesn't do what it claims to be able to do, or at least what it does do isn't very helpful.

[The documentation](https://api.rocket.rs/v0.5-rc/rocket/http/struct.CookieJar.html#method.get_private_pending) says
> Retrives the original or pending Cookie inside this collection with the name name and authenticates and decrypts the cookieâ€™s value. If the cookie cannot be found, or the cookie fails to authenticate or decrypt, None is returned.

However calling `get_private_pending` after calling `add_private` with the same cookie name, does not return the cookie just added. 

**To Reproduce**

```rust
#[get("/")]
fn handler(jar: &CookieJar<'_>) {
    jar.add_private(Cookie::new("name", "value"));
    assert!(jar.get_private_pending("name").is_some());
}
```

**Expected Behavior**

I would expect that `get_pending_cookie` would return the pending cookie if there is one, or the original cookie decrypted, or None,

**Environment:**

 - OS Distribution and Kernel: Manjaro Quonos 21.2.1 (Kernel 5.14.21)
 - Rocket Version: 0.5.0-rc.1

**Additional Context**

From looking at the code, I believe this bug is because  `get_private_pending` attempts to decrypt the cookie it found via `get_pending` regardless of if it was a newly added cookie, or one from the request. This is a problem because add_private doesn't actually appear to encrypt the cookie, instead it flags it as private and I assume it is encrypted later on. Due to this, the attempt to decrypt the pending cookie fails and so it appears as if there was no cookie at all.
